com.accele.gage

Class Registry<T extends Indexable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.Registry<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Indexable object this registry will store

    public class Registry<T extends Indexable>
extends java.lang.Object
    A general-purpose storage class for engine resources.

    All objects used in GAGE must be registered in an instance of this class. The main GAGE class contains the registries for all engine resources.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland
    See Also:
    GAGE, Indexable

    • Method Detail

      • addEntryAddCallback

        public void addEntryAddCallback(RegistryCallback<T> callback)
        Adds an entry-add callback to this Registry. The callback will be invoked whenever an entry is added to the registry.
        Parameters:
        callback - the RegistryCallback to add

      • addEntryRemoveCallback

        public void addEntryRemoveCallback(RegistryCallback<T> callback)
        Adds an entry-remove callback to this Registry. The callback will be invoked whenever an entry is removed from the registry.
        Parameters:
        callback - the RegistryCallback to add

      • register

        public void register(T entry)
        Registers the specified entry to this Registry. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument. All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-add callback list will be invoked if the entry can be registered.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument

      • getEntry

        public T getEntry(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the entry with the specified id. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the registry ID of the target entry
        Returns:
        the entry with the specified id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID

      • removeEntry

        public T removeEntry(java.lang.String id)
        Removes the entry with the specified id and returns the entry. An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID. All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-remove callback list will be invoked if the entry exists.
        Parameters:
        id - the registry ID of the target entry
        Returns:
        the entry with the specified id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID

      • getEntries

        public java.util.Collection<T> getEntries()
        Returns an immutable view of all entries in the Registry.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Collection of all entries in the Registry
